intro: Peristrophe serpenticola, commonly known as the snakeleaf grass, is a species of flowering plant in the grass family, Poaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries such as South Africa and Madagascar. The plant is characterized by its slender, often curved leaves that resemble the shape of a snake, giving it its common name. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Peristrophe serpenticola produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are typical of the grass family.
